name: Sociology of Masculinities
description: In this course students will engage with foundational material on the intersections of gender, sex, and sexuality as they relate to masculinity. This includes foundational work on hegemonic masculinity and multiple masculinities. [24L]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/231H5, 221H5, 0.5 SOC credit at the 200 level
exclusions: SOC345H5 S Special Topics in Sociology: SOC of Masculinities (20171)
